snippet.textDisplay: Reminds me of when I was young,huh? It left a really deep impression on me when I was a child,and it took awhile for me to find the game. That was years back,but I still really do love the music. I really should finish this game haha xD

snippet.textDisplay: The coldness of a fully technological city in contrast with the DEUS VULTness of the other kingdom makes this one even better.

snippet.textDisplay: YES! First time I played this game I literally set the DS down to listen to this more. Soundtrack continued to impress me and still holds the title for best-vgm-that-makes-me-cry-like-a-bitch

snippet.textDisplay: This is actually one of my favorite games. It's not much for repeated playthroughs as things get really tedious the second time around but those were some of the best 35 hours I've spent with a video game.
snippet.textOriginal: This is actually one of my favorite games. It's not much for repeated playthroughs as things get really tedious the second time around but those were some of the best 35 hours I've spent with a video game.

snippet.textDisplay: Yeah this song is evocative of many feelings. This really is a very good game. It's quite unique and I liked how the game flowed. Atlus being behind it I thought would have sold decently unless it was under printed.

tktktktktktktktktktktktktktktktktktktktktktktktktktk...

Hope this reminds you of the footstep sound that was, atleast to me, annoyingly loud compared to bgm :D
Still love this game, tho the game cost me around 80€ when i bought it new due to it getting caught in finnish tolls/customs :P
(55€ from the game, and then 10€ for shipping... rest was a sanction from trying to "evade taxes" :D

snippet.textDisplay:
This game was totally worth the important - and truly shimomura is a goddess in music design. 

I, for one, enjoyed the branching plots! Even the bad ends! The battle system was good too, I enjoyed decimating an enemy my making a huge combo with my team of aht, Raynie and stock, oft swapping Raynie with the big beast like guy! Even if it was only just for bonus exp.
snippet.textOriginal:
This game was totally worth the important - and truly shimomura is a goddess in music design.

snippet.textDisplay: Radiant Historia was recommended to me by the venerable HCBailly and to this day it remains one of my favorite JRPGs of all time. It has an incredible soundtrack, compelling characters, and one of the greatest story lines of a JRPG in recent memory. If you have not played this game, you owe to yourself to complete this gem.
snippet.textOriginal: Radiant Historia was recommended to me by the venerable HCBailly and to this day it remains one of my favorite JRPGs of all time. It has an incredible soundtrack, compelling characters, and one of the greatest story lines of a JRPG in recent memory. If you have not played this game, you owe to yourself to complete this gem.

snippet.textDisplay:
+HoppytheCourier I remember that Let's Play. HCBailly even wrote a walkthrough on GameFAQs (his GameFAQs account being Sleipnir2000).
I remember how after HCBailly's Let's Play ended, they made more copies of Radiant Historia. If it was only a coincidence, it's still an awesome coincidence.
snippet.textOriginal:
+HoppytheCourier I remember that Let's Play. HCBailly even wrote a walkthrough on GameFAQs (his GameFAQs account being Sleipnir2000).
I remember how after HCBailly's Let's Play ended, they made more copies of Radiant Historia. If it was only a coincidence, it's still an awesome coincidence.

snippet.textDisplay: It missed out on a decent print by under-printing which shot itself in the foot as far as sales.  It would have done alright if they had printed enough to meet demand.
snippet.textOriginal: It missed out on a decent print by under-printing which shot itself in the foot as far as sales.  It would have done alright if they had printed enough to meet demand.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm so glad I finally got to play this gem last summer. It's as good as Suikoden TIerkreis (maybe better).
snippet.textOriginal: I'm so glad I finally got to play this gem last summer. It's as good as Suikoden TIerkreis (maybe better).

snippet.textDisplay: Those cellos (?) are heavenly.
snippet.textOriginal: Those cellos (?) are heavenly.

snippet.textDisplay: It's so sad to hear this game didn't do so well, because in my opinion, I thought it was a fantastic RPG. Absolutely worth the time of anyone who enjoys a good dose of turn-based combat.
snippet.textOriginal: It's so sad to hear this game didn't do so well, because in my opinion, I thought it was a fantastic RPG. Absolutely worth the time of anyone who enjoys a good dose of turn-based combat.

snippet.textDisplay: It feels like jrpg many times becomes hidden gems. Would you recommend it? If so, how does it stand above other jrpgs? What makes it unique?
snippet.textOriginal: It feels like jrpg many times becomes hidden gems. Would you recommend it? If so, how does it stand above other jrpgs? What makes it unique?

snippet.textDisplay: I bought this game day one.  I think it's the best RPG on the DS by a mile.
snippet.textOriginal: I bought this game day one.  I think it's the best RPG on the DS by a mile.

snippet.textDisplay: bulbinking I understand the FE problem. You could always play Awakening, Birthright, Revelations, or Echoes though.
snippet.textOriginal: bulbinking I understand the FE problem. You could always play Awakening, Birthright, Revelations, or Echoes though.

snippet.textDisplay: You can change party,with a maximum of 3 members,but the ones that don't fight still receive a tiny amount of experience;it's not enough though and they fall behind pretty fast if you don't use them
snippet.textOriginal: You can change party,with a maximum of 3 members,but the ones that don't fight still receive a tiny amount of experience;it's not enough though and they fall behind pretty fast if you don't use them

snippet.textDisplay:
+bulbinking It's a matter of preference.  Radiant Historia is traditional and turn-based with a plot driven story while twewy is experimental and action-heavy with a character driven story.  Both did what they sought out to do well.  

At the time I craved something similar to Chrono Trigger and this was the closest they've gotten.  Unfortunately, the characters weren't nearly as memorable or developed.
snippet.textOriginal:
+bulbinking It's a matter of preference.  Radiant Historia is traditional and turn-based with a plot driven story while twewy is experimental and action-heavy with a character driven story.  Both did what they sought out to do well.  

At the time I craved something similar to Chrono Trigger and this was the closest they've gotten.  Unfortunately, the characters weren't nearly as memorable or developed.

snippet.textDisplay:
+Mimorin 
What about RPG's which grow you as the player from the story instead of watching everybody else grow and making "difficult" decisions for THEM?

I still think twewy is a more deserving title for best DS rpg for many reasons, especially the story, which had a big impact on me in my younger years as I am sure it did for many other people who played it.
snippet.textOriginal:
+Mimorin 
What about RPG's which grow you as the player from the story instead of watching everybody else grow and making "difficult" decisions for THEM?

I still think twewy is a more deserving title for best DS rpg for many reasons, especially the story, which had a big impact on me in my younger years as I am sure it did for many other people who played it.

snippet.textDisplay: Really loved this game.
snippet.textOriginal: Really loved this game.

snippet.textDisplay: Such a good game.
snippet.textOriginal: Such a good game.

snippet.textDisplay: While I thought the splitting timelines mechanic ended up feeling like a chore to manage, I did really enjoy Radiant Historia. You just don't see new RPG IPs that often anymore, especially on a handheld. It's unfortunate that it didn't sell well and it's another sad example of why developers prefer pumping out sequels for established franchises.
snippet.textOriginal: While I thought the splitting timelines mechanic ended up feeling like a chore to manage, I did really enjoy Radiant Historia. You just don't see new RPG IPs that often anymore, especially on a handheld. It's unfortunate that it didn't sell well and it's another sad example of why developers prefer pumping out sequels for established franchises.
